node.title: Moving to orange: 'We are quite divided in terms of risk'
node.description: Covid-19 restrictions for all of New Zealand will ease from midnight tonight but a leading epidemiologist says the country is divided in its risk.

node.title: California lawmaker pushes 32-hour workweek for big companies
node.description: Bill would make it the first state in the nation to adopt a four-day week for employees at bigger companies.

node.title: Southwest pilots' union raises safety concerns over fatigue
node.description: Pilots with the discount carrier are battling exhaustion due to poor scheduling, union officials say.

node.title: How to make summer travel plans that actually stick
node.description: Nervous that COVID-19 could again foil your vacation plans? Here are some tips for not getting burned.

node.title: US president accuses Putin of genocide in Ukraine
node.description: Joe Biden rails against "the horrible things that the Russians have done in Ukraine".

node.title: Maryland man with over 100 snakes in home died from snake bite
node.description: Officials found over 100 venomous and non-venomous snakes in the man's house, with the largest being a 14-foot Burmese python.

node.title: These retailers are rationing baby formula
node.description: In some states, more than half of baby formula products were out of stock, new data shows.

node.title: Actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleads guilty to forcible touching
node.description: The guilty plea came nearly three years after Gooding's arrest in the case.

node.title: "Operation Titanic": Government turns to satellite technology to detect icebergs
node.description: Over a 100 years after the sinking of the Titanic, the government is unveiling new technology to detect icebergs that may be hazardous to ships.

node.title: Kurt Cobain's "Smells Like Teen Spirit" guitar to be auctioned
node.description: A portion of the guitar's proceeds will be donated to the program "Kicking The Stigma," a national initiative to raise awareness about mental health disorders.

node.title: U.S. sending $800 million more in security aide to Ukraine as war shifts
node.description: The latest package will contain new capabilities for Ukraine including artillery systems, artillery rounds and armored personnel carriers.

node.title: Tennessee town spars with the state over control of its finances
node.description: Ford Motor Company is expected to build a new electric vehicle plant nearby.

node.title: Product shortages show fragility of U.S. supply chain
node.description: Online shoppers saw more than 3 billion "out of stock" notices in March across multiple categories.

node.title: Rain buckets down on East Coast: 'We're still trying to bounce back from our last storm'
node.description: Significant slips are starting to occur across Tairāwhiti as heavy rain continues to fall, and experts warn it will get worse.

node.title: King Salmon announces $73m loss; hopes to raise $60m to meet challenges
node.description: Marlborough-based King Salmon has made a large full year loss, and is raising more than $60 million to improve its balance sheet.

node.title: Yelp will pay for employees who need to travel to get abortions
node.description: The company's new coverage comes as more state pass laws that effectively ban legal abortions.

node.title: Soldiers with paratrooper before he was beheaded face courts-martial
node.description: Spc. Enrique Roman-Martinez' severed head washed ashore after he was reported missing, but his body was never recovered.

node.title: 3-year-old falls to her death from 411-foot waterfall
node.description: Other people have fallen to their deaths or been seriously injured at Whitewater Falls.

node.title: Spanish sides through to Champions League semi-finals
node.description: Holders knocked out of Champions League and Villareal return to final four after 16 years.

node.title: 'Cut and paste' climate change policy draws criticism
node.description: Councillor Stuart Wilson has rubbished Ashburton's updated climate change policy, voting against what he called a "cut and paste" document with no local focus.

node.title: Damning Black Ferns rugby report not a surprise to anyone
node.description: Māori and Pasifika female rugby players and advocates are asking to not be an afterthought.

node.title: Hospital's proposal to shut only primary birthing unit 'madness'
node.description: New Christchurch mums and midwives have marched to St George's Hospital to hand deliver a petition backed by more than 30,000 people to save the maternity unit from closure.

node.title: L.A. gangs are attacking and robbing people who leave high-end areas
node.description: As many as five carloads of people have followed home some targets, swarming them to steal watches, handbags or cars before they have much of a chance to resist, police said.

node.title: CDC extends mask requirement on planes, public transportation until May 3
node.description: The federal mask mandate on public transportation and airplanes was set to expire April 18.

node.title: Gilbert Gottfried reportedly died from a rare disease. Here's what we know.
node.description: The disease is the most common form of muscular dystrophy that begins in adulthood. It reportedly affected Gottfried's heart.

node.title: House-hunters frustrated by higher prices and fewer homes
node.description: "It's really defeating," one bidder said after losing out on a home despite offering more than the asking price.

node.title: Video appears to show suspect on his way to Brooklyn subway before attack
node.description: The video shows a man, wearing a reflective vest, wheeling a piece of luggage down the street and carrying a bag.

node.title: Why some Ukrainians are bristling over Pope Francis' Good Friday plans
node.description: Francis' decision to have Ukrainian and Russian families carry a cross during the "Way of the Cross" procession has drawn backlash from some prominent Ukrainian Catholics.

node.title: Second gentleman Doug Emhoff's chief of staff to depart
node.description: Julie Mason, a seasoned White House staffer, played a "significant role" in shaping the office and political strategy for the nation's first second gentleman, said one White House official.

node.title: Officials warned of cameras' vulnerability years before subway shooting
node.description: The manhunt has been hampered by what Mayor Eric Adams called an apparent "malfunction" with the security cameras at the station.
